name: Questions on Tea Trivia Quiz | Beverages (Non-Alcoholic) | 10 Questions

questions.text: What ancient Chinese figure is said to have discovered the use of tea?
questions.explanation:
Shen Nong.

	Shen Nong was later deified as the god of agriculture...as he was considered the first farmer!

questions.text: The spicy, milky tea from India is called what?
questions.explanation:
chai.

	Chai usually contains spices such as nutmeg...very delicious!

questions.text: What Chinese priest was called 'the tea maniac' because he devoted his entire life to tea?
questions.explanation:
Lu Dong.

	Lu Dong, a Daoist priest of 8th century Tang China, was so inspired by a poem by Chinese poet Lu Yu (called the 'Chajing') that he decided to spend his entire life looking for the perfect tea preparation!

questions.text: Which of the following tea names translates to 'Black Dragon' in English?
questions.explanation:
Oolong.

	'Long' means dragon in Chinese, while 'oo' (or 'ou') is a term for dark, black or murky.

questions.text: What tea is named for a British prime minister?
questions.correct: earl grey & earl grey tea & grey & gray & earl gray & earl gray tea
questions.explanation:
earl grey & earl grey tea & grey & gray & earl gray & earl gray tea.

	Earl Grey was PM from 1830-1834...he loved his tea! Earl Grey tea derives its special flavor from bergamot.

questions.text: Which Indian tea is the base for Irish Breakfast Tea?
questions.explanation:
Assam.

	Assam is the far eastern province of India, near the border with Myanmar.

questions.text: Young green tea whose leaves are rolled into a ball have what nickname?
Which tea can be described as 'Fujianese black, smoky tea which is produced by leaves shrivelled over pine fires'?
questions.explanation:
Lapsang Souchong.

	Fujian is a province of southern China, just opposite Taiwan.

questions.text: According to Japanese custom, should green tea be drunk with or without milk and sugar?
questions.explanation:
without.

	Most Japanese would be horrified by the addition of milk and sugar, a common custom for us Western folks!

questions.text: How do you say tea in Mandarin Chinese?
questions.explanation:
Cha.

	The word for tea in many languages is derived originally from the Chinese. For example, the English word 'tea' (from the Fujianese pronunciation).
